summary: H.R. 128, titled the "Fentanyl is a WMD Act," directs a specific office within the Department of Homeland Security—the Countering Weapons of Mass Destruction Office—to officially treat illicit fentanyl as a weapon of mass destruction. This designation would be for the purposes of Title XIX of the Homeland Security Act of 2002. By classifying illicit fentanyl in this manner, the bill aims to enable the use of specific national security tools, authorities, and resources to combat its trafficking and potential deployment as a weapon, framing the issue as a direct threat to national security.
